bwwExcerpt: Told through the deep, memorable Motown catalog, the show, directed by Des McAnuff ("Jersey Boys"), works best when it relies on great songs like "Papa Was a Rollin' Stone," "My Girl," "In the Still of the Night" (though many are frustratingly interrupted or cut short). Choreographer Sergio Trujillo gives the singers slick moves considerably more polished than the originals ever managed, while Robert Brill's efficient turntable set is highlighted by Peter Nigrini's projections that provide locat
